intro: Urera baccifera var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed urera, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
